citRespParty.rpOrgName: Grand Canyon Monitoring and Research Center

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool estimates the average channel width of the Colorado River between Glen Canyon Dam and Lake Meade for each user-defined river reaches. User-defined reaches may either be entered manually in the tool, or the user my provide a pre-authored text file containing a reach id, river mile start, and river mile end for each reach. The tool selects cross sections perpendicular to the river, obtains their width for the 8,000 cfs flow regime, and averages each cross section for a user-defined river reach. The tool outputs a shapefile containing the areal extent of the user-defined reach(es) with attributes containing the provide Reach ID and estimate average channel width.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Taylor C. Johnson (United States Geological Survey; Southwest Biological Science Center; Grand Canyon Monitoring and Research Center 2014)

Consts.useLimit: Currently, this script can only estimate the channel width for a flow event of approximately 8,000 cfs for the Colorado River between Glen Canyon Dam and Lake Meade (the extent is based on the GCMRC's river mile system). This tool only provides an estimate of channel width (which will change depending on user-specifications). It is not to be used for navigation. It is not to be used for the creation or comparison of legal boundary descriptions.

tool.name: ChannelWidth

param.name: riverFlow
param.dialogReference: This drop-down menu provides different flow regimes for which this tool will calculate average channel width. Higher flows typically have a wider channel depending on channel morphology. As of 12/13/2015, this tool can only analyze 8,000 cfs (more flows to be added later).

param.name: inReach
param.expression: {Reach ID {Mile Begin} {Mile End};Reach ID {Mile Begin} {Mile End}...}
param.dialogReference:
Use this value table to manually-specify river reaches to estimate channel width.

  1. In the text box, enter the reach ID

  2. Click the 'add' (plus sign) button

  3. In the value table, next to the newly added ID, type the start river mile

  4. In the value table, next to the start river mile, type the end river mile

  5. Repeat for all reaches to be estimated

param.name: inReachBoo
param.displayname: Input River Reaches From Text File
param.dialogReference: Check this box if you would like to supply the tool with a pre-authored text file containing one row for each reach to be calculated.

param.name: inReachTxt
param.dialogReference: The path to your pre-authored text file. Each row should included a reach ID (text that uniquely identifies each user-supplied reach), a river mile start, and a river mile end for each reach. Items in a row should be deliminated using a comma (,). For example, the first row of your text file could read: Reach 1, -15.78, 0.00)

param.name: outShp
param.dialogReference: An output shapefile containing one record for each river reach. The tool splits a polygon containing the area of the Colorado River at 8,000 cfs based on the provided river mile start and river mile end. The average channel width will be included as an attribute of each polygon in the output shapefile.

tool.summary: This tool estimates the average channel width of the Colorado River between Glen Canyon Dam and Lake Meade for each user-defined river reaches. User-defined reaches may either be entered manually in the tool, or the user my provide a pre-authored text file containing a reach id, river mile start, and river mile end for each reach. The tool selects cross sections perpendicular to the river, obtains their width for the 8,000 cfs flow regime, and averages each cross section for a user-defined river reach. The tool outputs a shapefile containing the areal extent of the user-defined reach(es) with attributes containing the provide Reach ID and estimate average channel width.
tool.usage:
To estimate channel width for any number of reaches:

  1. Choose an appropriate flow level of the Colorado River.

  2. Decide whether to provide a pre-authored text file or manually enter river reach specifications.

  3. Provide a name and location for the output shapefile.

mdContact.rpOrgName: Grand Canyon Monitoring and Research Center
